objects.name: Analytic 0499
objects.description: Correlated evidence of browser or webview fetches to uncommon domains or mutated JS resources (proxy/NGFW logs + Zeek/HTTP logs) followed by unexpected interpreters or script engines executing (python, ruby, sh) spawned from browser processes or user sessions, rapid on-disk staging in /tmp, and outbound connections that deviate from baseline. Defender sees: uncommon resource fetch → short-lived child process executions from user browser context → file writes in temp directories → anomalous outbound C2-like connections.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve: execve calls where a browser/webview process is parent and child is interpreter (python, sh, ruby) or downloader (curl, wget)

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Application or browser logs (webview errors, plugin enumerations) indicating suspicious script evaluation or plugin loads

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: http::response: HTTP responses with suspicious content-type for scripts, long obfuscated javascript bodies, or redirects to exploit kit domains

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:Sysmon
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: New files in /tmp, /var/tmp, $HOME/.cache, executed within TimeWindow after browser HTTP fetch

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Connections
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Outbound connections from newly spawned child processes or from the browser to uncommon endpoints or on anomalous ports

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Paths used for staging differ by distro and package manager; tune to include company-specific temp paths or exclude known benign build machines.
Whitelist known server/service accounts or CI/CD runners where shell executions are expected.
Threshold for flagging domains based on internal popularity vs global rarity.
